instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesn’t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PLT_RST_L: What is PLT_RST_L? This is an abbreviation of “PLT_RESET_L” – when you see “PLT_RST_L", assume the person meant to type PLT_RESET_L.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on in safe mode
threads.message: it suffered oxidation in the SMC region and on the other side, the Mac is slow and goes up in safe mode.  It already replaces the <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>, <CHIP>U5755</CHIP> and <CHIP>U5750</CHIP>.  <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.6V;  <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42V;  ALL 3.3V;  <SIGNAL>PLT_RST_L</SIGNAL> 3.3V;

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on in safe mode
threads.message: Reball SMC ALWAYS when you detect liquid sign close to it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on in safe mode
threads.message:
I made the SMC reball, but I'm still in safe mode, it replaces the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> chip, it worked, but the serial has changed, please edit ? 

S/N: C17FNQQYH2G


[URL unfurl="true"]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Laa0avtwwZJDuMs9LS8KpZc-L5KaHxIS/view?usp=sharing[/URL]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on in safe mode
threads.message:
Is this the backup BIOS from you board?

"it replaces the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> chip, it worked"
Do you mean it now works correctly, not slow anymore?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on in safe mode
threads.message: It is not slower, it normalized after replacing the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>. this is the backup.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on in safe mode
threads.message:
I don't understand you correctly.
If that is the original BIOS, was not good; machine didn't work good with it (was slow).
If you replace <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, did you wrote backup board on it?
If yes, why changed serial number?

Do you have now new <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> from other board and the serial from new board?
Is that the uploaded file?
In such case ME region must be cleaned, serial number modified and Fsys checksum fixed.

Please, specify which is the case...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on in safe mode
threads.message: I took a scrap card and removed the chip from it and put it on this Mac that I'm fixing, resolved.  I would not like to put the BIOS file from the old one because it is corrupted.  I need a file with that serial number that I gave you.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on in safe mode
threads.message:
So the dump uploaded is from the scrap board.
Then ME region MUST be cleaned too, not only changed serial number.
That's the reason I asked you to clarify.
I will make it tomorrow...
